index.title: Welcome
index.get-active-text: Discover and join organizations and events that work towards lasting change. Support the movements that matter most to you and learn from experienced activists along the way.
index.get-active-btn-alt-text: Learn more about getting involved in an activist organization
index.get-organized-text: Connect with others across organizations and movements. Host panel discussions, collect signatures, unionize your workplace, organize protests and much more.
index.get-organized-btn-alt-text: Learn more about organizing an activist organization
index.grow-organization-text: Showcase your organization's aims and structure. Automatically and securely onboard new members to easily gain and maintain momentum from one action to the next.
index.grow-organization-btn-alt-text: Learn more about growing an activist organization
index.activist-section-text: We're a Berlin-based team with a growing global network of affiliates and partners. Let's create a dedicated open-source platform to take on the challenges of our time.
index.our-supporters-text: Help us create and maintain a platform that enables people to safely engage in activism. Please consider contributing your skills, reach or money.
index.our-supporters-sub-text: Sponsorship does not equal influence. activist is independent and governed by its community.

index.title: About
index.paragraph-1: We're a Berlin-based team with a growing global network of affiliates and partners. Our goal is to create and maintain a platform that enables more people to safely engage in activism, learn from experienced organizers as well as replicate proven and novel strategies and tactics for social and ecological change.
index.paragraph-2: We're building a free, open-source and privacy-focused technical infrastructure that can rival with the commercial campaigning tools that are often inaccessible â€” financially and/or technically â€” to small progressive organizations.
index.paragraph-3: We want to end their dependance on Big Tech infrastructure and put tools of social action into the hands of everyone willing to work towards a more equitable society. Well-executed campaign tactics should not be the exception for well-funded, tech-savvy activists, but a tool for all participants in social movements.
index.paragraph-4: That also means building a user experience that is easy and fun to use while establishing security best-practices from the very beginning. From signup to regularly organizing events. Imagine every person new to activism showing up well-prepared to their first meeting â€” guided by the knowledge and tools of veteran organizers â€” and immediately being able to contribute a meaningful cause.
index.paragraph-5-pt1: Interested in helping? Please visit us
index.paragraph-5-pt3: to contribute code, translations or suggestions to the project. You're also welcome to join us in our
index.paragraph-5-pt5: to share ideas, ask questions or just say hi :) For activists already involved in an organization, please use the form in the
index.paragraph-5-pt7: button below to get in contact with us. We'll be in touch soon after!

impress.title: Impress
impress.paragraph-1: activist.org is a network for political action that allows people to coordinate and collaborate on the issues that matter most to them. The current goal is the creation of a central platform to discover activist organizations and their events.
impress.paragraph-2: We are currently working on the legal entity behind activist. Further information will be available on this page once the arrangements are finalized. Thank you for your patience!
impress.message: We look forward to hearing from you :)

roadmap.title: Roadmap
roadmap.paragraph-1: activist.org is open-source software. Our goal is to build in as transparent a manner as possible so that partner organizations and our community can have as much input on the process as possible.
roadmap.paragraph-2-pt3: for a full overview of the current issues and features being worked on. You're also welcome to join us in our public
roadmap.paragraph-2-pt5: to share ideas, ask questions or just say hi :)

get-active.modal-image-alt-text: Mockups that show mobile organization search and web event search on a map.
get-active.title: Get Active
get-active.paragraph-1-pt1: activist has the goal of making finding political
get-active.paragraph-1-pt5: near you as easy as possible. With each event we want people to have an opportunity to get involved in the organization that's putting it on, and once in an organization we want to make it easy to find what to do next to have the biggest impact.
get-active.list: Events are broken down based on the following criteria
get-active.list-subitem-1: Environment, refugees, housing and countless others
get-active.list-subitem-2: Search based on the level of involvement you want
get-active.paragraph-2: Organizations are also categorized based on the the movements they work on to make them easy to find. From there it's up to you to show up to an event and follow up on becoming a regular contributor, but we aim to take as much friction out of this process as possible.
get-active.paragraph-3-pt3: link below to tell us more about you and your activism! We'd also love to hear from you in our
get-active.paragraph-3-pt5: so we know how best to help you in your work.

get-organized.modal-image-alt-text: Mockups that show mobile resource search and web event task organization.
get-organized.title: Get Organized
get-organized.paragraph-1-pt1: There will be so much more to an
get-organized.paragraph-1-pt3: on activist than a time and a place. We want to create an ecosystem of tools that allows organizers to onboard new joiners; keep track of all the tasks that need to be done to make the event a success; enable discussions with other organizations while providing event organizers with a direct voice to those attending; as well as provide needed information to make sure that everyone is safe and knows their rights while participating.
get-organized.paragraph-2: One event is never enough though, so activist has the goal of linking political actions so that everyone involved knows the steps needed to have the biggest effect. Pre- and post-events will build and maintain momentum, while events hosted by more than one organization will allow for easier collaboration.
get-organized.paragraph-3-pt1: Events and organizations will also be able to create and organize
get-organized.paragraph-3-pt3: to make their work easier. Resources can include anything from news stories to spread information; images and graphs that make a strong point for action; research articles to expand knowledge about an issue; and much more.
get-organized.paragraph-4-pt3: link below to tell us more about how you'd like to use activist! We'd also love to hear from you in our
get-organized.paragraph-4-pt5: where our community plans all aspects of activist.

grow-organization.modal-image-alt-text: Mockups that show mobile event join flow interests selection and web organization affiliates page.
grow-organization.title: Grow Organization
grow-organization.paragraph-1-pt1: activist is first and foremost about
grow-organization.paragraph-1-pt3: with the design of the platform being tailored to their needs. The main function of organizations on activist is organizing and hosting
grow-organization.paragraph-1-pt5: but future features aim to help them achieve their goals and scale more effectively.
grow-organization.paragraph-2: With activist you can keep track of all your pads, protocols, decisions and events in one place while at the same time quickly onboarding new joiners to your political actions. We want to inspire as well as improve collaboration between organizations because we know that we're only going to be able to sustain action together.
grow-organization.paragraph-3-pt1: Of paramount importance to activist's health is the
grow-organization.paragraph-3-pt3: for all organizations. We'll start with a select few that will then help us choose all future organizations that join the platform. In this way we hope to instill trust in the community â€” that no organization has not been vouched for, and that when interacting with a person they are verified and brought in by people that others work with.
grow-organization.paragraph-4: Long term features will integrate every aspect of an organization's political life: making working groups and assigning tasks; releasing statements to their supporters; finding and tailoring actions based on real life legislation; and much more!
grow-organization.paragraph-5-pt3: link below to tell us more about your organization! We'd also love to hear from you in our
grow-organization.paragraph-5-pt5: so we know how best to help your organization.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.subtitle-1: Please join our community in the
faq.question-1: Q: What does the activist "a" mean?
faq.answer-1: The center of the letter represents an arrow that points left-center from the top. This symbolizes our community and direction: that we want to work with the left and center of the political spectrum and value a democratic movement of power down to the people. Other meanings are welcome :D
faq.question-2: Q: How does activist plan to prevent abuse?
faq.answer-2: The big focus of activist is organizations. We will start with a select few organizations based in Berlin where the core team is located, with further organizations being added through applications that need approval from the community. Users themselves will have a limited scope of interaction if they're not in an organization. When we get to a point where public discussions are happening, a user will only be able to participate if they're a member of an organization.
faq.answer-3: Thank you for asking! Privacy is a major concern for the team as we understand that activism can be very dangerous. Working in the open allows our code to be checked for vulnerabilities, and we welcome feedback in this regard. Between functionality and privacy we will always choose the latter. This means that some features of activist will take longer to make sure that they're created in a way that keeps people safe.
faq.question-4: Q: What's the best way to get in touch?
faq.answer-4-pt1: activist uses Matrix for communications. You're welcome to
faq.answer-4-pt2: join us in our public chat rooms
faq.answer-4-pt3: to share ideas, ask questions, find ways to help the platform grow or to just say hi :)

contact.title: Contact
contact.page-title: We'd love to hear from you!
contact.paragraph-1-pt1: Thanks for your interest in connecting with the activist.org team. Please consider joining the
contact.paragraph-1-pt3: for simple inquiries and suggestions. The community including the development team would be happy to help! Feature requests should also be sent via our open-source codebase
contact.paragraph-2-pt1: For other inquiries, please use the contact form on this page. In using this form we ask that you respect our
contact.thanks-1: Thank you for contacting the activist team!
contact.thanks-2: We appreciate you taking the time to reach out. We'll do our best to get back to you as quickly as possible. Thank you for your patience!

privacy-policy.title: Privacy
privacy-policy.paragraph-1: At activist.org, we value your privacy and are committed to maintaining the trust and confidence of our users. This Privacy Policy explains how we handle your information and the choices you have regarding your information.
privacy-policy.paragraph-2: By using activist.org, you agree to the provisions of this Privacy Policy. Our primary goal is to provide a platform that allows users to engage in activism without compromising their privacy. We have implemented various measures to ensure the privacy and security of our users. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact us.
privacy-policy.paragraph-3: activist.org does not collect any personal information from our users. We do not collect data such as names, email addresses, phone numbers, or any other information that can be used to identify you personally at this time. Our platform is designed to provide a safe and private environment for activism and collaboration.
privacy-policy.paragraph-4: As an open-source platform, we prioritize transparency and user control. We encourage users to contribute to activist.org and share their ideas, questions, and concerns. We also strive to provide a platform that fosters inclusivity and support for all users, regardless of their background.
privacy-policy.paragraph-5: As we do not collect personal information, we do not use any such information for any purpose. Our goal is to provide a platform that allows users to engage in activism without compromising their privacy.
privacy-policy.paragraph-6: We aim to foster a sense of community and collaboration among users, allowing them to connect with like-minded individuals and organizations. We also work to provide resources and tools that enable users to learn about and engage with important social, political, and environmental issues.
privacy-policy.paragraph-7: We do not share your personal information with any third parties, nor do we use any third-party services that collect or process personal information. activist.org is dedicated to ensuring the privacy of our users and maintaining a secure platform.
privacy-policy.paragraph-8: As an open-source platform, we collaborate with various organizations and individuals who share our values and goals. We strive to build partnerships that enhance the functionality and reach of activist.org while maintaining our commitment to user privacy and security.
privacy-policy.paragraph-9: We are committed to protecting the security of our platform and the information of our users. In the event of a data breach, we will promptly notify affected users and take appropriate measures to address the situation.
privacy-policy.paragraph-10: We implement various security measures, such as encryption and secure connections, to protect the integrity of our platform and the safety of our users. We also encourage users to practice good security habits, such as using strong passwords and enabling two-factor authentication when available.
privacy-policy.paragraph-11: As we do not collect personal information, you do not need to worry about exercising any rights related to your personal data. However, if you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or our practices, please feel free to contact us.
privacy-policy.paragraph-12: We are committed to transparency and user control. We encourage users to contribute to activist.org and participate in discussions about privacy, security, and other important topics. By engaging with our community, you can help shape the future of activist.org and ensure that it remains a safe, inclusive, and empowering platform for all.
privacy-policy.paragraph-13: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. If we make significant changes, we will notify you through the platform or by other means. By continuing to use activist.org after any changes are in effect, you agree to the updated Privacy Policy.
privacy-policy.paragraph-14: We encourage users to regularly review this Privacy Policy to stay informed about our privacy practices and any changes that may occur. Your continued use of activist.org constitutes your acceptance of any updates to our Privacy Policy.
privacy-policy.paragraph-15: Please contact us if you have any questions, comments, or concerns about this Privacy Policy or our practices. We welcome feedback from our users and are always looking for ways to improve our platform and better serve our community.
privacy-policy.paragraph-16: That also means building a user experience that is easy and fun to use while establishing security best-practices from the very beginning. From signup to regularly organizing events. Imagine every person new to activism showing up well-prepared to their first meeting â€” guided by the knowledge and tools of veteran organizers â€” and immediately being able to contribute a meaningful cause.
privacy-policy.paragraph-17-pt1: Interested in helping? Please visit us
privacy-policy.paragraph-17-pt3: to contribute code, translations or suggestions to the project. You're also welcome to join us in our
privacy-policy.paragraph-17-pt5: to share ideas, ask questions or just say hi :)

trademark-policy.title: Trademark
trademark-policy.paragraph-1: The activist name and logos are trademarks of activist.org, soon to be incorporated as activist gGmbH. As such, their use is restricted and protected by intellectual property law. While the software we create is available under a free and open source software license, the copyright license does not include an implied right or license to use our trademarks.
trademark-policy.paragraph-2: The role of trademarks is to prevent the exploitation of the good name and reputation of activist.org by other people and organizations, and to provide assurance about the quality of the products and services associated with it.
trademark-policy.paragraph-3: To use our trademarks beyond what is considered "fair" or "nominative" use, you must follow these guidelines. By making use of our trademarks, you agree to abide by the following terms and conditions.
trademark-policy.paragraph-4: You agree to defend and indemnify activist.org from and against any and all claims and losses brought by a third party in connection with your use of the activist.org trademarks.
trademark-policy.paragraph-5-pt1: To request the use of the activist name and logos in a way not covered in these guidelines, or to report violations, please contact us at
trademark-policy.paragraph-5-pt2: In the event that we do not approve such use of the activist name and logos within fourteen (14) business days, your request shall be deemed denied.
trademark-policy.list1-item1: Only use the activist marks to accurately identify those goods or services that are built by the activist.org organization.
trademark-policy.list1-item2: Do not use the activist marks in any way that could mistakenly imply that activist.org has reviewed, approved, or guaranteed your goods or services.
trademark-policy.list1-item3: Do not use or register, in whole or in part, the activist marks as part of your own or any other trademark, service mark, domain name, company name, trade name, product name, or service name.
trademark-policy.list1-item4: Do not use the activist marks in a manner that disparages or defames the marks, activist.org, or other products associated with activist.org.
trademark-policy.list1-item5: You may use the activist word mark in referential phrases such as "for", "as found on", etc.
trademark-policy.list1-item6: You may use the activist marks when embedding or otherwise displaying user generated content published using the activist software.
trademark-policy.list1-item7: Do not change or modify the activist marks aside from color adjustments.
trademark-policy.list1-item8: Any all use of the activist marks, and any goodwill accrued as a result of that use, belongs entirely to, and shall inure for the benefit of, activist.org.
trademark-policy.paragraph-6: If you choose to build on or modify activist's open-source code, beyond modifications limited to switching on or off features already included in the software, minor tweaks in visual appearance, translations into other languages, and bug fixes:
trademark-policy.list2-item1: You must choose your own branding, logos, and trademarks that denote your unique identity so as to clearly signal to users that there is no affiliation with or endorsement by activist.org.
trademark-policy.list2-item2: You may use word marks, but not our logos, in truthful statements that describe the relationship between your software and ours, for example "this software is derived from the source code of activist.org".
trademark-policy.list3-item1: In addition, activist logos cannot be used in a way that might suggest affiliation with or endorsement by activist.
trademark-policy.paragraph-7: Please contact us if you have any questions, comments, or concerns about this Trademark Policy. We welcome feedback from our users and are always looking for ways to improve our platform and better serve our community.
trademark-policy.paragraph-8-pt1: Interested in helping? Please visit us
trademark-policy.paragraph-8-pt3: to contribute code, translations or suggestions to the project. You're also welcome to join us in our
trademark-policy.paragraph-8-pt5: to share ideas, ask questions or just say hi :)

splash.message: Let's build a platform where movements grow and people are inspired to act on the issues that affect us all. Free, open-source, privacy-focused and driven by our community.

tech-banner.github-text: We're dedicated to working in the open to build trust with out partner organizations and fellow activists. Building the place for activism the world over takes a lot of effort, so please come join us!
